page.title: 09RELIGION IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: Trelawnyd has two active chapels and one church. As elsewhere, there is a decline in the number of regular churchgoers. The largest regular congregation is at the St.Michaels and all Angels Church which was built in the l3th century, and numbers about 25. This Church shares its incumbent with the adjoining parishes of Cwm and Dyserth. The Vicar resides in Dyserth , and the Vicarage has been privately sold. The Church was re-roofed in l983 at a cost of Â£l3,000. This repayment of a loan for this work and a heavy quota of Â£1,500 places a large financial burden on the members. The chapels are suffering from a decline in the number of welsh speakers and their congregations are slowly diminishing. In l984 thE Wesleyan Chapel was closed.
